learn

Class BayesRelationClassifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • learn.BayesRelationClassifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRelationClassifier

    public class BayesRelationClassifier
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRelationClassifier
    A relation classifier. Let X = (y_1, y_2, x_1, x_2, ..., x_n) be an feature vector with (y_1, y_2) are the entity labels. It firstly selects the kNN(y_1,y_2) , a kNN model trained for the given label combination. Then use the kNN to predict: x_1 --> m_1_1, m_1_2, m_1_3, ..., m_1_k x_2 --> m_2_1, m_2_2, m_2_3, ..., m_2_k ... x_n --> m_n_1, m_n_2, m_n_3, ..., m_n_k Where: m_i_j = (d_i_j, f_i_j, r_i_j) with f_i_j a feature, r_i_j a relation and d_i_j the calculated distant to x_i After this calculate for each possible relation r: Mul_{i=1}^{n} 1/k * Sum_{j=1}^{k} f(i, j, r) with: f(i, j, r) = (1 - d_i_j) * P(r_i_j | f_i_j) if r_i_j == r f(i, j, r) = 0 otherwise Take the relation r with the highest calculated value
